tool.name: ART 454
tool.command:
art_454 $t
$aln $sam
#if $rndSeed and $rndSeed > -1: -r $rndSeed #end if
#if $c -c $c #end if
#if $generate.amplicon.use_amplicon == "amplicon_true": #if $generate.choice == "single_end": -A #else: -B #end if #end if
$input_seq_file output
#if $generate.choice == "single_end": $fold_coverage #else: $fold_coverage $generate.fragment_size $generate.fragment_sd #end if
#if $generate.amplicon.use_amplicon == "amplicon_true": #if $generate.choice == "single_end": $generate.amplicon.reads_per_amplicon #else: $generate.amplicon.read_pairs_per_amplicon #end if #end if ;
## Move to correct output locations. #if $generate.choice == "single_end": mv output.fq output1.fq; #if str($aln) == "-a": mv output.aln output1.aln; #end if #end if

param.label: the fold of read coverage over the reference sequences
param.name: fold_coverage

param.label: number of reads per amplicon (for 5'end amplicon sequencing)
param.name: reads_per_amplicon

param.label: the average DNA fragment size for paired-end read simulation
param.name: fragment_size

param.label: the standard deviation of the DNA fragment size for paired-end read simulation
param.name: fragment_sd

param.label: number of read pairs per amplicon (for two-end amplicon sequencing)
param.name: read_pairs_per_amplicon

param.label: indicate to simulate reads from the built-in GS FLX Titanium profile (-t)
param.name: t

param.label: specify the number of flow cycles by the sequencer [100 for GS-FLX, 200 for GS-FLX Titanium] (-c)
param.name: c

tool.help:
Art 454 Pyrosequencing Simulator ================================
ART_454 is a simulation program to generate sequence read data of Roche 454 Pyrosequencing sequencers. ART generates reads according to the empirical read quality profile and the calibrated error profile of uncall/overcall homopolymers from real 454 read data. ART has been using for testing or benchmarking a variety of method or tools for next-generation sequencing data analysis, including read alignment, de novo assembly, detection of SNP, CNV, or other structure variation.
art_454 can generate both single-end and paired-end of 454 sequencing platform. Besides for regular genome DNA and cDNA sequencing simulation, art_454 also supports amplicon sequencing. The reference sequences can be either DNA or RNA.
